item.title: Towers of Hanoi in Lambda Calculus

content.p: The Towers of Hanoi is a well-known problem that is widely used as an example when explaining the concept of recursion. Solutions to the problem have been constructed in numerous systems (mostly programming languages). Try M-x hanoi in Emacs for a nice example.
However, I haven't been able to find a solution to the Towers of Hanoi in Lambda Calculus. So I constructed one and wrote a short explanation on how one would do such a thing.
Towers of Hanoi in Lambda Calculus (pdf 90Kb)
